{"step_by_step_thinking": "ICD-10 is a widely used medical classification system. Let's break down the options:

A. International Classification of Drugs, 10th revision - This option is incorrect because ICD-10 does not classify drugs.

B. International Classification of Disabilities, 10th revision - This option is incorrect because ICD-10 primarily focuses on diseases, not disabilities.

C. International Classification of Diseases, 10th revision - This option is correct. ICD-10 stands for International Classification of Diseases, 10th revision. It is a system used for classifying and coding diseases, injuries, and other health conditions.

D. International Classification of Disasters, 10th revision - This option is incorrect because ICD-10 does not pertain to disasters.", "answer_choice": "C"}
